attributes.action: welcome your support and assistance in our endeavour to alleviate the suffering of our Tamil brethren in their North-East homeland in the island of Sri Lanka.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British Tamils Forum
24/11/06

The Right Honourable Tony Blair, MP, 
The Prime Minister
No 10, Downing Street
London, 
SW1A 2AA
Dear Prime Minister,
We, British Tamil Diaspora are seriously concerned about the worsening humanitarian crisis and killings of innocent Tamil civilians in Sri Lanka. 
Hence, a wide range of groups and organizations (total 88)working to support the advancement of an estimated 150,000 strong Tamil community in the United Kingdom have taken the unprecedented step of placing an advert in The Times newspaper, which will appear on Monday 27th November 2006, the day that United Nations will be discussing the Sri Lankan crisis. 
We would welcome your support and assistance in our endeavour to alleviate the suffering of our Tamil brethren in Sri Lanka.
Thanking you
Yours sincerely
N.Suganthakumaran
On behalf of the British Tamils Forum
